alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson County through 445 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tiffin, or 7 miles west of Iowa City, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Iowa City, Coralville, North Liberty, Tiffin, University Heights, Hills, Oakdale, Iowa City Municipal Airport, Frytown, Windham, Johnson County Fairgrounds, Hills Access, Cosgrove, F.W. Kent Park, West Overlook, University Of Iowa, Sharon Center, and Coralville Lake Dam Complex. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 230 and 250. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
